title: How to Make a Chunky Crunchy Banana Muesli

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 175 °C (347 °F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine oats, almonds, pumpkin seeds and raisins.
In a separate bowl, add peeled bananas and mash them with a fork until they have a smooth consistency.
steps.description: Then pour honey and oil onto the banana mash and stir together.

steps.headline: Add the banana mixture to the large bowl with the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Using your hands, combine until you have a all-coated and clumpy mixture.

steps.headline: Tip your muesli onto the prepared baking tray and spread evenly.
Place on the middle rack in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes – after around 7 to 10 minutes turn the muesli over with a spatula.
When cooled completely, put and store in an airtight container.
Serve with milk or yoghurt and add some fresh fruit.

text: Preheat the oven to 175 °C (347 °F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.  In a large bowl, combine oats, almonds, pumpkin seeds and raisins. Add vanilla and salt. In a separate bowl, add peeled bananas and mash them with a fork until they have a smooth consistency. Then pour honey and oil onto the banana mash and stir together. Add the banana mixture to the large bowl with the dry ingredients. Using your hands, combine until you have a all-coated and clumpy mixture. Tip your muesli onto the prepared baking tray and spread evenly.  Place on the middle rack in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes – after around 7 to 10 minutes turn the muesli over with a spatula.  When cooled completely, put and store in an airtight container.  Serve with milk or yoghurt and add some fresh fruit.
